properties.name: debug
properties.description: Enable debug logs.

properties.name: logging.charset.console
properties.description: Charset to use for console output.

properties.name: logging.charset.file
properties.description: Charset to use for file output.

properties.name: logging.config
properties.description: Location of the logging configuration file. For instance, `classpath:logback.xml` for Logback.

properties.name: logging.exception-conversion-word
properties.description: Conversion word used when logging exceptions.

properties.name: logging.file.name
properties.description: Log file name (for instance, `myapp.log`). Names can be an exact location or relative to the current directory.

properties.name: logging.file.path
properties.description: Location of the log file. For instance, `/var/log`.

properties.name: logging.group
properties.description: Log groups to quickly change multiple loggers at the same time. For instance, `logging.group.db=org.hibernate,org.springframework.jdbc`.

properties.name: logging.level
properties.description: Log levels severity mapping. For instance, `logging.level.org.springframework=DEBUG`.

properties.name: logging.logback.rollingpolicy.clean-history-on-start
properties.description: Whether to clean the archive log files on startup.

properties.name: logging.logback.rollingpolicy.file-name-pattern
properties.description: Pattern for rolled-over log file names.

properties.name: logging.logback.rollingpolicy.max-file-size
properties.description: Maximum log file size.

properties.name: logging.logback.rollingpolicy.max-history
properties.description: Maximum number of days archive log files are kept.

properties.name: logging.logback.rollingpolicy.total-size-cap
properties.description: Total size of log backups to be kept.

properties.name: logging.pattern.console
properties.description: Appender pattern for output to the console. Supported only with the default Logback setup.

properties.name: logging.pattern.dateformat
properties.description: Appender pattern for log date format. Supported only with the default Logback setup.

properties.name: logging.pattern.file
properties.description: Appender pattern for output to a file. Supported only with the default Logback setup.

properties.name: logging.pattern.level
properties.description: Appender pattern for log level. Supported only with the default Logback setup.

properties.name: logging.register-shutdown-hook
properties.description: Register a shutdown hook for the logging system when it is initialized.

properties.name: spring.application.name
properties.description: Application name.

properties.name: spring.banner.charset
properties.description: Banner file encoding.

properties.name: spring.banner.image.bitdepth
properties.description: Bit depth to use for ANSI colors. Supported values are 4 (16 color) or 8 (256 color).

properties.name: spring.banner.image.height
properties.description: Height of the banner image in chars (default based on image height).

properties.name: spring.banner.image.invert
properties.description: Whether images should be inverted for dark terminal themes.

properties.name: spring.banner.image.location
properties.description: Banner image file location (jpg or png can also be used).

properties.name: spring.banner.image.margin
properties.description: Left hand image margin in chars.

properties.name: spring.banner.image.pixelmode
properties.description: Pixel mode to use when rendering the image.

properties.name: spring.banner.image.width
properties.description: Width of the banner image in chars.

properties.name: spring.banner.location
properties.description: Banner text resource location.

properties.name: spring.beaninfo.ignore
properties.description: Whether to skip search of BeanInfo classes.

properties.name: spring.config.activate.on-cloud-platform
properties.description: Required cloud platform for the document to be included.

properties.name: spring.config.activate.on-profile
properties.description: Profile expressions that should match for the document to be included.

properties.name: spring.config.additional-location
properties.description: Config file locations used in addition to the defaults.

properties.name: spring.config.import
properties.description: Import additional config data.

properties.name: spring.config.location
properties.description: Config file locations that replace the defaults.

properties.name: spring.config.name
properties.description: Config file name.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.connectionfactory.borrow-connection-timeout
properties.description: Timeout, in seconds, for borrowing connections from the pool.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.connectionfactory.ignore-session-transacted-flag
properties.description: Whether to ignore the transacted flag when creating session.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.connectionfactory.local-transaction-mode
properties.description: Whether local transactions are desired.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.connectionfactory.maintenance-interval
properties.description: Time, in seconds, between runs of the pool's maintenance thread.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.connectionfactory.max-idle-time
properties.description: Time, in seconds, after which connections are cleaned up from the pool.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.connectionfactory.max-lifetime
properties.description: Time, in seconds, that a connection can be pooled for before being destroyed. 0 denotes no limit.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.connectionfactory.max-pool-size
properties.description: Maximum size of the pool.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.connectionfactory.min-pool-size
properties.description: Minimum size of the pool.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.connectionfactory.reap-timeout
properties.description: Reap timeout, in seconds, for borrowed connections. 0 denotes no limit.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.connectionfactory.unique-resource-name
properties.description: Unique name used to identify the resource during recovery.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.connectionfactory.xa-connection-factory-class-name
properties.description: Vendor-specific implementation of XAConnectionFactory.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.connectionfactory.xa-properties
properties.description: Vendor-specific XA properties.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.datasource.borrow-connection-timeout
properties.description: Timeout, in seconds, for borrowing connections from the pool.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.datasource.concurrent-connection-validation
properties.description: Whether to use concurrent connection validation.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.datasource.default-isolation-level
properties.description: Default isolation level of connections provided by the pool.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.datasource.login-timeout
properties.description: Timeout, in seconds, for establishing a database connection.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.datasource.maintenance-interval
properties.description: Time, in seconds, between runs of the pool's maintenance thread.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.datasource.max-idle-time
properties.description: Time, in seconds, after which connections are cleaned up from the pool.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.datasource.max-lifetime
properties.description: Time, in seconds, that a connection can be pooled for before being destroyed. 0 denotes no limit.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.datasource.max-pool-size
properties.description: Maximum size of the pool.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.datasource.min-pool-size
properties.description: Minimum size of the pool.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.datasource.reap-timeout
properties.description: Reap timeout, in seconds, for borrowed connections. 0 denotes no limit.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.datasource.test-query
properties.description: SQL query or statement used to validate a connection before returning it.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.datasource.unique-resource-name
properties.description: Unique name used to identify the resource during recovery.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.datasource.xa-data-source-class-name
properties.description: Vendor-specific implementation of XAConnectionFactory.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.datasource.xa-properties
properties.description: Vendor-specific XA properties.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.properties.allow-sub-transactions
properties.description: Specify whether sub-transactions are allowed.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.properties.checkpoint-interval
properties.description: Interval between checkpoints, expressed as the number of log writes between two checkpoints. A checkpoint reduces the log file size at the expense of adding some overhead in the runtime.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.properties.default-jta-timeout
properties.description: Default timeout for JTA transactions.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.properties.default-max-wait-time-on-shutdown
properties.description: How long should normal shutdown (no-force) wait for transactions to complete.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.properties.enable-logging
properties.description: Whether to enable disk logging.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.properties.force-shutdown-on-vm-exit
properties.description: Whether a VM shutdown should trigger forced shutdown of the transaction core.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.properties.log-base-dir
properties.description: Directory in which the log files should be stored. Defaults to the current working directory.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.properties.log-base-name
properties.description: Transactions log file base name.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.properties.max-actives
properties.description: Maximum number of active transactions.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.properties.max-timeout
properties.description: Maximum timeout that can be allowed for transactions.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.properties.recovery.delay
properties.description: Delay between two recovery scans.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.properties.recovery.forget-orphaned-log-entries-delay
properties.description: Delay after which recovery can cleanup pending ('orphaned') log entries.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.properties.recovery.max-retries
properties.description: Number of retry attempts to commit the transaction before throwing an exception.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.properties.recovery.retry-interval
properties.description: Delay between retry attempts.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.properties.serial-jta-transactions
properties.description: Whether sub-transactions should be joined when possible.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.properties.service
properties.description: Transaction manager implementation that should be started.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.properties.threaded-two-phase-commit
properties.description: Whether to use different (and concurrent) threads for two-phase commit on the participating resources.

properties.name: spring.jta.atomikos.properties.transaction-manager-unique-name
properties.description: The transaction manager's unique name. Defaults to the machine's IP address. If you plan to run more than one transaction manager against one database you must set this property to a unique value.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.connectionfactory.acquire-increment
properties.description: Number of connections to create when growing the pool.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.connectionfactory.acquisition-interval
properties.description: Time, in seconds, to wait before trying to acquire a connection again after an invalid connection was acquired.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.connectionfactory.acquisition-timeout
properties.description: Timeout, in seconds, for acquiring connections from the pool.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.connectionfactory.allow-local-transactions
properties.description: Whether the transaction manager should allow mixing XA and non-XA transactions.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.connectionfactory.apply-transaction-timeout
properties.description: Whether the transaction timeout should be set on the XAResource when it is enlisted.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.connectionfactory.automatic-enlisting-enabled
properties.description: Whether resources should be enlisted and delisted automatically.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.connectionfactory.cache-producers-consumers
properties.description: Whether producers and consumers should be cached.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.connectionfactory.class-name
properties.description: Underlying implementation class name of the XA resource.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.connectionfactory.defer-connection-release
properties.description: Whether the provider can run many transactions on the same connection and supports transaction interleaving.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.connectionfactory.disabled
properties.description: Whether this resource is disabled, meaning it's temporarily forbidden to acquire a connection from its pool.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.connectionfactory.driver-properties
properties.description: Properties that should be set on the underlying implementation.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.connectionfactory.ignore-recovery-failures
properties.description: Whether recovery failures should be ignored.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.connectionfactory.max-idle-time
properties.description: Time, in seconds, after which connections are cleaned up from the pool.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.connectionfactory.max-pool-size
properties.description: Maximum size of the pool. 0 denotes no limit.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.connectionfactory.min-pool-size
properties.description: Minimum size of the pool.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.connectionfactory.password
properties.description: Password to use to connect to the JMS provider.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.connectionfactory.share-transaction-connections
properties.description: Whether connections in the ACCESSIBLE state can be shared within the context of a transaction.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.connectionfactory.test-connections
properties.description: Whether connections should be tested when acquired from the pool.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.connectionfactory.two-pc-ordering-position
properties.description: Position that this resource should take during two-phase commit (always first is Integer.MIN_VALUE, always last is Integer.MAX_VALUE).

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.connectionfactory.unique-name
properties.description: Unique name used to identify the resource during recovery.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.connectionfactory.use-tm-join
properties.description: Whether TMJOIN should be used when starting XAResources.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.connectionfactory.user
properties.description: User to use to connect to the JMS provider.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.acquire-increment
properties.description: Number of connections to create when growing the pool.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.acquisition-interval
properties.description: Time, in seconds, to wait before trying to acquire a connection again after an invalid connection was acquired.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.acquisition-timeout
properties.description: Timeout, in seconds, for acquiring connections from the pool.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.allow-local-transactions
properties.description: Whether the transaction manager should allow mixing XA and non-XA transactions.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.apply-transaction-timeout
properties.description: Whether the transaction timeout should be set on the XAResource when it is enlisted.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.automatic-enlisting-enabled
properties.description: Whether resources should be enlisted and delisted automatically.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.class-name
properties.description: Underlying implementation class name of the XA resource.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.cursor-holdability
properties.description: Default cursor holdability for connections.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.defer-connection-release
properties.description: Whether the database can run many transactions on the same connection and supports transaction interleaving.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.disabled
properties.description: Whether this resource is disabled, meaning it's temporarily forbidden to acquire a connection from its pool.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.driver-properties
properties.description: Properties that should be set on the underlying implementation.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.enable-jdbc4-connection-test
properties.description: Whether Connection.isValid() is called when acquiring a connection from the pool.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.ignore-recovery-failures
properties.description: Whether recovery failures should be ignored.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.isolation-level
properties.description: Default isolation level for connections.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.local-auto-commit
properties.description: Default auto-commit mode for local transactions.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.login-timeout
properties.description: Timeout, in seconds, for establishing a database connection.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.max-idle-time
properties.description: Time, in seconds, after which connections are cleaned up from the pool.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.max-pool-size
properties.description: Maximum size of the pool. 0 denotes no limit.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.min-pool-size
properties.description: Minimum size of the pool.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.prepared-statement-cache-size
properties.description: Target size of the prepared statement cache. 0 disables the cache.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.share-transaction-connections
properties.description: Whether connections in the ACCESSIBLE state can be shared within the context of a transaction.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.test-query
properties.description: SQL query or statement used to validate a connection before returning it.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.two-pc-ordering-position
properties.description: Position that this resource should take during two-phase commit (always first is Integer.MIN_VALUE, and always last is Integer.MAX_VALUE).

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.unique-name
properties.description: Unique name used to identify the resource during recovery.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.datasource.use-tm-join
properties.description: Whether TMJOIN should be used when starting XAResources.

properties.name: spring.main.allow-bean-definition-overriding
properties.description: Whether bean definition overriding, by registering a definition with the same name as an existing definition, is allowed.

properties.name: spring.main.banner-mode
properties.description: Mode used to display the banner when the application runs.

properties.name: spring.main.cloud-platform
properties.description: Override the Cloud Platform auto-detection.

properties.name: spring.main.lazy-initialization
properties.description: Whether initialization should be performed lazily.

properties.name: spring.main.log-startup-info
properties.description: Whether to log information about the application when it starts.

properties.name: spring.main.register-shutdown-hook
properties.description: Whether the application should have a shutdown hook registered.

properties.name: spring.main.sources
properties.description: Sources (class names, package names, or XML resource locations) to include in the ApplicationContext.

properties.name: spring.main.web-application-type
properties.description: Flag to explicitly request a specific type of web application. If not set, auto-detected based on the classpath.

properties.name: spring.mandatory-file-encoding
properties.description: Expected character encoding the application must use.

properties.name: spring.output.ansi.enabled
properties.description: Configures the ANSI output.

properties.name: spring.pid.fail-on-write-error
properties.description: Fails if ApplicationPidFileWriter is used but it cannot write the PID file.

properties.name: spring.pid.file
properties.description: Location of the PID file to write (if ApplicationPidFileWriter is used).

properties.name: spring.profiles.active
properties.description: Comma-separated list of active profiles. Can be overridden by a command line switch.

properties.name: spring.profiles.include
properties.description: Unconditionally activate the specified comma-separated list of profiles (or list of profiles if using YAML).

properties.name: spring.reactor.debug-agent.enabled
properties.description: Whether the Reactor Debug Agent should be enabled when reactor-tools is present.

properties.name: trace
properties.description: Enable trace logs.

properties.name: logging.file
properties.description: Log file name (for instance, `myapp.log`). Names can be an exact location or relative to the current directory.

properties.name: logging.file.clean-history-on-start
properties.description: Whether to clean the archive log files on startup. Only supported with the default logback setup.

properties.name: logging.file.max-history
properties.description: Maximum number of days archive log files are kept. Only supported with the default logback setup.

properties.name: logging.file.max-size
properties.description: Maximum log file size. Only supported with the default logback setup.

properties.name: logging.file.total-size-cap
properties.description: Total size of log backups to be kept. Only supported with the default logback setup.

properties.name: logging.path
properties.description: Location of the log file. For instance, `/var/log`.

properties.name: logging.pattern.rolling-file-name
properties.description: Pattern for rolled-over log file names. Supported only with the default Logback setup.

properties.name: spring.application.index
properties.description: Application index.

deprecation.reason: Application context ids are now unique by default.

properties.name: spring.main.show-banner
properties.description: Display the banner when the application runs.

properties.name: spring.main.web-environment
properties.description: Run the application in a web environment (auto-detected by default).

properties.name: spring.profiles
properties.description: Comma-separated list of profile expressions that at least one should match for the document to be included.

values.description: Root logger used to assign the default logging level.
SQL logging group including Hibernate SQL logger.
